intro: Calliandra haematostoma, commonly known as the bloodflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive red and yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces long, cylindrical flower clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Calliandra haematostoma thrives in warm, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
